info.description: The Amazon Shipping API is designed to support outbound shipping use cases both for orders originating on Amazon-owned marketplaces as well as external channels/marketplaces. With these APIs, you can request shipping rates, create shipments, cancel shipments, and track shipments.
info.title: Amazon Shipping API

parameters.name: locale
parameters.description:
The IETF Language Tag. Note that this only supports the primary language subtag with one secondary language subtag (i.e. en-US, fr-CA).
The secondary language subtag is almost always a regional designation.
This does not support additional subtags beyond the primary and secondary language subtags.

post.description:
Purchases a shipping service and returns purchase related details and documents.

Note: You must complete the purchase within 10 minutes of rate creation by the shipping service provider. If you make the request after the 10 minutes have expired, you will receive an error response with the error code equal to "TOKEN_EXPIRED". If you receive this error response, you must get the rates for the shipment again.

**Usage Plan:**

| Rate (requests per second) | Burst |
| ---- | ---- |
| 80 | 100 |

The `x-amzn-RateLimit-Limit` response header returns the usage plan rate limits that were applied to the requested operation, when available. The table above indicates the default rate and burst values for this operation. Selling partners whose business demands require higher throughput may see higher rate and burst values then those shown here. For more information, see [Usage Plans and Rate Limits in the Selling Partner API](https://developer-docs.amazon.com/sp-api/docs/usage-plans-and-rate-limits-in-the-sp-api).

parameters.name: accessPointTypes
parameters.description: Access point types

x-docgen-enum-table-extension.description: Counter, aka Helix, is an assisted access point where customers interact with a store associate to collect or return packages. Counter stores do not have Locker
It denotes a physical Locker present at Locker+ stores
Omni lockers are similar to core lockers installed at apartment buildings. Core and Omni will have common base hardware platform

Odin lockers rely on Bluetooth connection as there is no screen or scanner on the locker. Drivers, customers, and even technicians can interact with the locker using an app (different depending on the user).
Dobby lockers are Odin lockers installed at apartment complexes and available only to residents.

Core lockers are the traditional and initial style of lockers when Hub was launched. Core lockers have a screen, keypad and scanner.  Customer either enter their pickup code using the Locker screen or scan pickup code barcode to pick up their package.

Networks that are owned end-to-end by commercial carriers (CC - e.g. DHL, UPS, DPD and Postal organizations), who operate both the transportation leg and the access point aspect. These networks offer a range of pickup points including: 3P Lockers, legacy Postal Offices, 3P Counters (e.g. Gas Stations and Retail Outlets - supermarkets, bookstores, news-stands etc).

Locker+, formerly known as Campus, are attended, physical stores, where the Locker is used dynamically by the staff to keep packages ready for customer pickup. Locker+ store can have multiple Lockers installed,

invoiceNumber.description: The invoice number of the item.

invoiceDate.description: The invoice date of the item in ISO 8061 format.

ChargeList.description: A list of charges based on the shipping service charges applied on a package.

x-docgen-enum-table-extension.description: A tax imposed on a package.

A metric unit of length, equal to one hundredth of a meter.

Dimensions.description: A set of measurements for a three-dimensional object.

RequestToken.description: A unique token generated to identify a getRates operation.

RateId.description: An identifier for the rate (shipment offering) provided by a shipping service provider.

CarrierId.description: The carrier identifier for the offering, provided by the carrier.

AccountId.description: Identifier for the seller's carrier account.

CarrierName.description: The carrier name for the offering.

PackageClientReferenceId.description: A client provided unique identifier for a package being shipped. This value should be saved by the client to pass as a parameter to the getShipmentDocuments operation.

ShipmentId.description: The unique shipment identifier provided by a shipping service.

DetailCodes.description: A list of codes used to provide additional shipment information.

x-docgen-enum-table-extension.description: Attempted delivery but the business was closed.
Attempted delivery but the recipient was unavailable.
Attempted delivery but cash was not available from recipient.
Attempted delivery but the recipient did not have the PIN available.
Attempted delivery but could not access the recipient location.
Attempted delivery but unable to contact the recipient to coordinate delivery.
Shipment delivered to front porch or front door.
Shipment delivered and signed for by neighbor.
Shipment delivered to rear porch or rear door.

Shipment was damaged. When paired with Rejected this indicates the recipient refused to accept the shipment because the shipment was damaged. When paired with UNDELIVERABLE it means the shipment was undeliverable due to being damaged and may be returned to the seller.
Recipient refused to accept the shipment because the shipment contains incorrect item/s.
Recipient refused to accept the shipment because the recipient did not want the shipment.
Recipient refused to accept the shipment.
Recipient refused to accept the shipment and provided verification.
Shipment was cancelled by the recipient. This tag is paired with the rejected shipment status.
Shipment is undeliverable and is returning to seller because the address was missing or incorrect.
Shipment is undeliverable and is returning to the seller.
Package arrived at the local facility.

TrackingDetailCodes.description: Contains detail codes that provide additional details related to the forward and return leg of the shipment.

forward.description: Contains detail codes that provide additional details related to the forward leg of the shipment.

returns.description: Contains detail codes that provide additional details related to the return leg of the shipment.

TrackingId.description: The carrier generated identifier for a package in a purchased shipment.

ClaimId.description: The claim identifier originally returned by the createClaim operation.

AlternateLegTrackingId.description: The carrier generated reverse identifier for a returned package in a purchased shipment.

ServiceId.description: An identifier for the shipping service.

ServiceName.description: The name of the shipping service.

AdditionalAddressNotes.description: Address notes to re-attempt delivery with.

deliveryNotes.description: The delivery notes for the shipment

name.description: The name of the person, business or institution at the address.

addressLine1.description: The first line of the address.

companyName.description: The name of the business or institution associated with the address.

email.description: The email address of the contact associated with the address.

phoneNumber.description: The phone number of the person, business or institution located at that address, including the country calling code.

Geocode.description: Defines the latitude and longitude of the access point.

StateOrRegion.description: The state, county or region where the person, business or institution is located.

City.description: The city or town where the person, business or institution is located.

CountryCode.description: The two digit country code. Follows ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 format.

PostalCode.description: The postal code of that address. It contains a series of letters or digits or both, sometimes including spaces or punctuation.

AccessPointType.description: The type of access point, like counter (HELIX), lockers, etc.

x-docgen-enum-table-extension.description: Counter, aka Helix, is an assisted access point where customers interact with a store associate to collect or return packages. Counter stores do not have Locker
It denotes a physical Locker present at Locker+ stores
Omni lockers are similar to core lockers installed at apartment buildings. Core and Omni will have common base hardware platform

Odin lockers rely on Bluetooth connection as there is no screen or scanner on the locker. Drivers, customers, and even technicians can interact with the locker using an app (different depending on the user).
Dobby lockers are Odin lockers installed at apartment complexes and available only to residents.

Core lockers are the traditional and initial style of lockers when Hub was launched. Core lockers have a screen, keypad and scanner.  Customer either enter their pickup code using the Locker screen or scan pickup code barcode to pick up their package.

Networks that are owned end-to-end by commercial carriers (CC - e.g. DHL, UPS, DPD and Postal organizations), who operate both the transportation leg and the access point aspect. These networks offer a range of pickup points including: 3P Lockers, legacy Postal Offices, 3P Counters (e.g. Gas Stations and Retail Outlets - supermarkets, bookstores, news-stands etc).

Locker+, formerly known as Campus, are attended, physical stores, where the Locker is used dynamically by the staff to keep packages ready for customer pickup. Locker+ store can have multiple Lockers installed,
